documents.title: thanks everyone !
text: guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:31pm so , i hope we can do this again sometime .
thank you for writing in with your ( mostly ) very thoughtful questions .
i hope my answers were okay for you all .
take care everyone .
markx
jack evans asks : what are you most excited about in music in 2015 ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:29pm i 'm really looking forward to the action bronson album ( which i also produced two songs on ) .
i 've heard some of the jamie xx album which is really incredible .
and the hudmo album is amazing too .
i think people are going to be surprised at how symphonic and soulful that it is .
those are a few things to mention .
elywhitley asks : the video for uptown funk , and bruno mars in general on stage , reminds me of morriss day and the time .
are there any influences from that era ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:26pm bruno directed the video , along with cameron duddy .
the time were so visually striking , i really looked up to them as a kid .
new jack city , the film , was also an influence .
paddy o'brien asks : george clinton or james brown ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:25pm without james brown , there would be no george clinton .
but george is certainly a genius .
i 've been listening to alot of parliament & funkadelic and brides of dr funkenstein lately .
it 's mind blowing
mackermonty1977 asks : love uptown funk !
very deserving to be at the top of the uk charts .
parts of it do remind me of duran 's skin trade .
was that an influence at all ?

guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:23pm duran duran were responsible for a lot of the first `` funk '' music i heard growing up , from `` notorious '' to the `` reflex '' , etc they always said that they wanted to sound like chic so that makes sense .
i learned alot , and continue to learn alot , from those men .
pauline amon asks : how many days or months or years did u work to make the uptown funk ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:21pm it took about 7 months to finish `` uptown funk '' .
bruno was on tour so me and jeff ( bhasker , who co-produced the album with me ) would go meet him whenever he had a day off .
whether it was in los angeles , memphis , toronto or london .
lorenzo martã­nez asks : any plans on releasing another version-like album ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:19pm version was such an unexpected thing .
i made the covers just so i could play them in my dj sets and then zane lowe and gilles peterson started playing `` just '' and i ended up getting a record deal from it .
i feel really strongly about those batch of songs .
i 'm not sure if there 's another batch of 12 songs that i feel so strongly about that i would want to do another covers album .
id023949 asks : looking across your discography do you have a favourite song ?
until yesterday mine was ooh wee with ghostface and nate dogg but i love i ca n't lose with keyone starr - i think it 's my new favourite .
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:17pm i still like hearing `` ooh wee '' and it 's pretty great to me that it still gets played in hip hop clubs 10 years later .
`` i ca n't lose '' is definitely one of my favourites off the new record .
as is `` summer breaking '' .
you have great taste .
subhajitbanerjee asks : just how cool was it to deejay at paul mccartney 's wedding and then produce part of an album for him ?
are there any tracks from those sessions that still remain unreleased ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:16pm i 'm not afraid to say i enjoy dj'ing weddings .
you can play alot of fun tunes that you might not get away with at the coronet in brixton as for sir paul 's wedding , `` temporary secretary '' was a big hit .
`` crazy in love '' is always great for weddings .

documents.title: `` i wrote for a few heavy metal fanzines in my teenage years . i still enjoy some pantera ''
text: nadia dahan asks : if you were n't doing music , what would you be doing ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:12pm i 'm not sure .
i 've been playing music as early as i can remember .
i did enjoy writing about music alot though .
i wrote for my high school paper in ny reviewing gigs and interviewing rappers like krs-one .
i also wrote for a few heavy metal fanzines in my teenage years .
i still enjoy some pantera .

documents.title: mark 's fondest memory of amy winehouse : `` we recorded valerie for version in an hour or so . that was a pretty magical day ''
text: id8209602 asks : what 's your fondest memory of amy ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:10pm i love the day that we went to daptone studios in brooklyn , ny for the first time .
back to black had just come out but she had n't met all the musicians that had played on the album .
i introduced her to nick , homer , tommy , victor and binky ( the musicians ) and they all were laughing for a while .
and then we recorded valerie for version in an hour or so .
that was a pretty magical day .
robertclarke asks : mark , your upcoming album , uptown special , is the first one you have released that does n't feature you or your face on the cover .
was this a proactive decision or something you never really considered ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:08pm brian roettinger came up with an amazing logo , way superior to my face
ivanna asks : this really is n't really a question but i really admire your work and everything you do .
it 's really rare for me to find an album that i can listen to straight through without skipping a song and uptown special is one of them .
i can tell you spent so much time on each song until it was perfect .
my birthday happens to be on monday , is there a possibility you can just wish me happy birthday ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:05pm yes , happy birthday ivanna .

documents.title: `` hudson mohawke is one of my favourite producers of the past few years ''
text: darren mccaughey asks : what happened to the album track with hudson mohawke ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:05pm hudson mohawke is one of my favourite producers of the past few years .
the song he co-produced on my album unfortunately had to be left off at the last minute due to sample issues .
but i 'm hoping to fix it and then put the song out in the spring .
it also had a $ ap rocky on it .
it 's a banger .
by the way , hudmo 's own album is coming soon .
i 've heard most of it and it 's ridiculous .

documents.title: mark ronson is in the building !
text: looking smoother than a fresh jar of skippy mark ronson
sandyy4 asks : what lyrics did you write on uptown funk ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:02pm i wrote a few .
but `` julio , get the stretch ! ''
is the one i 'm most proud of .
i just wanted one line that people would yell out in the club .
tinygiant asks : mark , have you got any idea how bitcoin works ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:02pm sometimes in conversations , i pretend to .
but actually i do n't .
and i 've read about it 15 times and i still ca n't grasp it .
zenjard asks : how come your track was ripped off by fleur on xfactor ?
did you give permission for them to use the song ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 3:00pm i think they had permission because we were supposed to perform it on the show ourselves .
it all worked out for the best .
i felt strongly that the song should be out right away and by fleur peforming the song , that 's what happened .
eatmorechips asks : do people ever mistake you for jon ronson ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 2:59pm no .
but i met him at bestival .
we hugged .
intheweed5 asks : mark , do you roar at the beginning and the end of uptown funk because the song was such a you-know-what to write ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 2:58pm that roar is philip lawrence aka phil smeeze .
he co wrote the song and is an incredible roarer .
i think he would beat katy perry in a roaring contest
gary aw asks : why did you talk over the amy winehouse demos you played on evr and where are her back to black recording sessions ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 2:57pm i play alot of things on evr , demos etc , because i enjoy letting the listeners hear things in their early stages .
amy 's demos are amazing and it 's inspiring to hear where her ideas came from , however , i did n't feel right just leaving them out completely exposed .
it was more for people to hear a slice of them .
lucas robertson asks : which producer has inspired you the most in your career ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 2:54pm i think it 's been a combination of a few .
quincy jones , for the sheer brilliance of his arrangements and quality of work .
dj premier , for beats .
and gabriel roth and tommy brenneck from daptone/dunham for teaching me how to record live instruments .
rainydaydude asks mark - do you regret djing at the conservative party conference ?
guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 2:52pm i can promise you that this never happened .
i do n't know where this rumour started but thank you for asking , so i can finally lay it to rest .
briella101 asks stevie wonder playing the harmonica , how did that come about ?

guardian contributor markronson1 16 january 2015 2:51pm i wrote the melody which was inspired by the lyrics of michael chabon and then i became completely fixated on the sound of stevie 's harmonica playing it , every time i heard the melody in my head .
so i sent his manager the song and he liked it and played it .
it 's definitely the high point of my musical career so far .
he is my hero in every way

documents.title: post your questions for mark ronson
text: being a trendy music producer can even acknowledging the endless rounds of parties and cross-continental glamour be a bit of a tough gig .

one year 's musical trends can easily be old hat the next , as mark ronson more or less acknowledged as much in a recent guardian interview : you know you 're cold , industry-wise , because you see all the gigs going to your friends .
he may have pioneered a vintage soul sound with amy winehouse that dominated the zeitgeist , but now pop 's all gone a bit ibiza is he high and dry ?
actually , far from it like daft punk before him , he scored a massive hit with old-school disco-funk that swam against the prevailing tide .
uptown funk reached no 1 and gave christmas some much-needed sass , while the album it 's taken from , uptown special , is being feted for its ty slick arrangements and michael chabon lyric book .
with the album out on 19 january , mark is joining us to answer your questions in a live webchat , from 2.45pm gmt onwards on friday 16 january .
post yours in the comments section below , and he 'll answer as many as possible .
